source_sentence: 爾時薄伽梵，與五百漁人出家圓具已，從薜舍離詣竹林聚落北，有升攝波林依之而住。
translation: It was then that the Bhagavān and his five hundred fishermen renounced their homes and became fully ordained, left Vaiśālī, went to the north of the bamboo forest village, and stayed in the Śākyamuni Forest to rely on him.

source_sentence: 時逢飢饉乞食難得，父母於子尚不相濟，況餘乞人！
translation: When they're hungry and beg for food that's difficult to obtain, their parents aren't even able to help each other when they're born, so why wouldn't the other beggars?

source_sentence: 爾時世尊告諸苾芻曰：「今時飢饉乞食難得，父子尚不相濟，汝等宜應各隨親友得意之處，於薜舍離隨近聚落而作安居。
translation: It was then that the Bhagavān addressed the monks, saying, Now that it's so hungry and difficult to beg for food, father and son aren't yet able to help each other, you should each follow your friends and relatives wherever they want to go and make a peaceful retreat in Vaiśālī or nearby villages.

source_sentence: 我與阿難陀於此林住。」
translation: I and Ānanda are staying here in this forest.

source_sentence: 苾芻聞已唯然受教，各隨親友於薜舍離隨近聚落而作安居。
translation: After hearing this, the monks simply accepted the teaching and each followed their friends and relatives to live in peace in a village nearby Vaiśālī.

source_sentence: 時彼五百善來苾芻，見斯事已共相告曰：「仁等當知如世尊說：『今時飢饉乞食難得，父子尚不相濟，況餘乞人！
translation: When those five hundred well-come monks saw this, they all told each other, You should know that as the Bhagavān said, 'Nowadays, it's difficult to get hungry and beg for food, so parents and children won't help each other, much less the other beggars!'

source_sentence: 汝等宜應各隨親友，於薜舍離隨近聚落而作安居。
translation: It's better for you to each follow your friends and relatives, make a peaceful retreat in the village nearby from Vaiśālī.

source_sentence: 我與阿難陀於此林住。』
translation: I and Ānanda are staying here in this forest.'

source_sentence: 我等於此無有眷屬，可得依止作安居事。
translation: We have no dependents here, so we can rely on them to make our living.

source_sentence: 然於捕漁人村有我眷屬，宜往相問，於其村外權為草室而作安居。」
translation: However, if there's a family of mine in a village where they catch fish, it's advisable to go and ask each other questions, and I'll make a peaceful retreat outside that village for the right to build a grass dwelling.

source_sentence: 時五百苾芻即便往至捕漁村所，問其眷屬權為小室村外居停。
translation: The five hundred monks then went to the fishing village and asked their dependents what right they had to live outside the small dwelling village.

source_sentence: 時諸苾芻共相謂曰：「我等少聞未有學識，若諸親眷來相請問，我等云何為其說法？」
translation: The monks then said to each other, We've heard little and haven't studied consciousness; if our relatives come to ask questions, how can we preach for them?

source_sentence: 「若彼來時我等宜應更相讚歎，汝諸眷屬大獲善利，汝聚落中得有如是勝妙僧眾於此安居。
translation: If it's appropriate for us to praise each other again when they come, your retinues will greatly attain good benefits, and in your village there will be such a wonderful congregation of monks who live here.

source_sentence: 此苾芻得無常想，於無常苦想、於苦空想、於空無我想、厭離食想、於諸世間無愛樂想、過患想、斷除想、離欲想、滅想、死想、不淨想、青瘀想、膖脹想、膿流想、蟲食想、血塗想、離散想、白骨想、觀空想，此苾芻得初靜慮、二靜慮、三靜慮、四靜慮，得慈悲喜捨、空無邊處、識無邊處、無所有處、非想非非想處，此得四果六神通八解脫。」
translation: This monk has the perception of impermanence, the perception of impermanence and suffering, the perception of suffering as impermanent, the perception of emptiness as suffering, the perception of emptiness as selflessness, the perception of emptiness without self, the perception of disenchantment with food, the perception of craving for all worlds, the perception of affliction,

source_sentence: 後於異時彼諸眷屬來相看問，時諸苾芻見眷屬來，即便更互共相讚歎：「汝諸眷屬大獲善利，汝聚落中得有如是勝妙僧眾於此安居。
translation: Later, at another time, those members of the retinue came to see each other and asked questions, and when the monks saw the members of the retinue coming, they even praised each other, saying, Your members of the retinue have greatly gained good benefits, and in your village there's such a group of wonderful monks who are staying here.

source_sentence: 此苾芻得無常想，廣說乃至得八解脫。」
translation: This monk attains the perception of impermanence and explains it in detail until he attains the eight liberations.

source_sentence: 時諸眷屬既聞說已，白言：「聖者！
translation: After hearing the teaching, the members of the assembly said, Sage!

source_sentence: 仁等證得如是勝果。」
translation: You people will realize such a superior result.

source_sentence: 答言：「皆得。」
translation: He replied, They'll all attain it.

source_sentence: 時俗諸人聞得果者咸生愛樂，於自父母妻子親屬而不拯濟，於諸苾芻各以飲食共相供給。
translation: When the people of the secular world heard the fruit, they all became fond of it and didn't save their own parents, wives, relatives, or other monks from being offered food and drink to each other.

source_sentence: 爾時世尊未入涅槃安住於世，與諸弟子二時大集：一謂五月十五日欲安居時；
translation: At that time the World-honored One, who had not entered nirvana and was dwelling peacefully in the world, assembled with his disciples at two different times:

source_sentence: 二謂八月十五日隨意了時。
translation: Second, it's the time of the fifteenth day of the eighth month when he understands it as he wishes.

source_sentence: 若前安居者受教勅已往詣城邑村坊聚落而作安居，至隨意了皆來集會，隨所證獲皆悉白知，其未證者請求證法。
translation: If someone who previously made a peaceful retreat receives the instruction, they go to cities, villages, towns, and villages and make a peaceful retreat, gather as many people as they wish, explaining everything they've realized, and those who haven't realized it ask to realize the teaching.

source_sentence: 近薜舍離安居苾芻，三月既滿作衣已竟，顏色憔悴形容羸瘦，執持衣鉢往竹林村。
translation: When the monk who was staying at Vaiśālī had finished making his robes for three months, he looked emaciated and slender in appearance. Carrying his robe and bowl, he went to the bamboo grove village.

source_sentence: 既至村已，時具壽阿難陀遙見諸苾芻，於同梵行者起憐愛心，遙唱善來即前迎接，為持衣鉢錫杖君持，并餘雜物沙門資具。
translation: When he arrived at the village, Kauśinagara Ānanda saw the monks from a distance who were fellow practitioners of the same religious life and became compassionate toward them. He called out to greet them by saying “Welcome!’ from a distance.” They came forward to meet him, holding his robe, almsbowl, pewter bowl, pewter staff, and other miscellaneous belongings

source_sentence: 又問：「具壽！
translation: Again, he asked, Kauṣṭhila!

source_sentence: 仁等何處安居而得來至？」
translation: Where did you people stay and come from?

source_sentence: 答言：「我於佛栗氏聚落三月安居，今來至此。」
translation: He replied, I've been staying in the village of Vṛji for three months, and now I'm coming here.

source_sentence: 阿難陀曰：「諸仁於彼安居三月之內，乞求飲食不勞苦耶？」
translation: Ānanda said, Wouldn't it be painful for you to beg for food and drink during the three months of their retreat?

source_sentence: 答曰：「雖於彼處得安樂住，然乞飲食甚大艱辛。」
translation: He answered, Even though they can live peacefully there, it's a great difficulty to beg for food and drink.

source_sentence: 爾時阿難陀即便報曰：「實爾，具壽！
translation: It was then that Ānanda even reported, Indeed, Kauṣṭhila!

source_sentence: 目驗衰羸、容貌憔悴，准知飲食定是難求。」
translation: My eyes are weak and my appearance is emaciated, and I know that food and drink are certainly difficult to obtain.

source_sentence: 時捕漁村五百苾芻既安居了，執持衣鉢亦至此村，顏色鮮好容貌肥盛。
translation: When the five hundred monks from the fishing village had settled down, they also came to this village with their robes and bowls in hand. Their appearance was fresh and good-looking, and their appearance was rich and fat.

source_sentence: 時阿難陀遙見諸苾芻，於同梵行者起憐愛心，遙唱善來即前迎接，為持衣鉢并餘雜物。
translation: When Ānanda saw the monks from a distance, he became compassionate toward those who practiced the same celibacy and called out to welcome them from a distance, carrying their robes, bowls, and other miscellaneous things.

source_sentence: 如前具問乃至問言：「於捕漁村飲食易求安樂行不？」
translation: As before, he asked in detail and even asked, Is it easy to seek food and drink in a fishing village for peaceful behavior?

source_sentence: 苾芻報曰：「我於彼住實得安樂，所求飲食易得不難。」
translation: The monk replied, I'll really attain peace while staying there, and it won't be difficult to obtain food or drink that I'm seeking.

source_sentence: 阿難陀報言：「具壽！
translation: Ānanda replied, Kauṣṭhila!

source_sentence: 目驗肥充容色光澤，准知飲食定是易求。」
translation: His eyes are fat and full, his appearance shiny and lustrous, and he knows that food and drink are certainly easy to find.

source_sentence: 時阿難陀即便問曰：「今既時世飢饉飲食難求，父母妻子尚不相濟，何故仁等食易得耶？」
translation: Ānanda then asked, Now that there's so much hunger and food in the world and it's difficult to find food and drink, why is it easy to obtain food for your parents and wives?

source_sentence: 彼便答曰：「我於眷屬自相讚歎云：『此苾芻得無常想，乃至得八解脫。』」
translation: He then answered, I praised myself among my followers, saying, 'This monk has attained the perception of impermanence and even attained the eight liberations.'

source_sentence: 阿難陀問曰：「所陳之事為實？
translation: Ānanda asked, Is the thing that's presented true?

source_sentence: 為虛？」
translation: Why is it false?

source_sentence: 答言：「是虛。」
translation: He replied, It's false.

source_sentence: 問言：「具壽！
translation: He asked, Kauṣṭhila!

source_sentence: 仁等豈合為少飲食，實無上人法自稱得耶？」
translation: Wouldn't it be better for you to have a little food and drink, which is really the self-proclaimed attainment of the unsurpassed person's teaching?

source_sentence: 彼便答曰：「從合不合，我等已作。」
translation: They then replied, Since they don't fit together, we've done it.

source_sentence: 時諸苾芻樂少欲者，皆共譏嫌呵責非法：「云何汝等為貪飲食，實無上人法自稱得耶？」
translation: The monks who enjoyed few desires then all criticized and rebuked the unlawful, Why are you addicted to food and drink and really unsurpassed in terms of people's ability to claim to have attained it?

source_sentence: 時諸苾芻以緣白佛。
translation: The monks then reported this to the Buddha for his sake.

source_sentence: 佛以此緣集苾芻眾，知而故問如前廣說。
translation: Because of this reason, the Buddha gathered the monks together and knowing it, he asked questions as explained in detail above.

source_sentence: 佛問勝慧河邊諸苾芻曰：「汝諸苾芻實無上人法自言得耶？」
translation: The Buddha asked the monks at the side of the river of superior wisdom, Are you monks really the unsurpassed person who claims to have attained it?

source_sentence: 彼白佛言：「實爾。
translation: They said to the Buddha, It's true.

source_sentence: 大德！」
translation: Great virtuous one!

source_sentence: 爾時世尊種種呵責諸苾芻：「汝非沙門、非隨順行，所不應為，非威儀、非出家者所作。
translation: It was then that the Bhagavān variously reprimanded the monks, saying, You aren't an ascetic or a follower, and what you shouldn't do is not done by someone who doesn't have manners or leaves home.

source_sentence: 汝諸苾芻！
translation: You monks!

source_sentence: 應知世間有三大賊。
translation: You should know that there are three great thieves in the world.

source_sentence: 云何為三？
translation: What are these three?

source_sentence: 諸苾芻！
translation: Monks!

source_sentence: 如有大賊若百眾若千眾若百千眾，便往到彼城邑聚落，穿牆解鑰偷盜他物，或時斷路傷殺，或時放火燒村，或破王庫藏，或劫掠城坊，是名第一大賊住在世間。
translation: Suppose there's a great thief who goes to another city or village with a hundred people, a thousand people, or a hundred thousand people, and penetrates walls, unlocks keys, steals the property of others, sometimes cuts off roads and inflicts harm, sometimes sets fire to burn a village, destroys the king's treasury, or plunders the city.

source_sentence: 諸苾芻！
translation: Monks!

source_sentence: 如有大賊無百眾無千眾無百千眾，不往城邑聚落穿牆解鑰偷盜他物，亦不斷路燒村破王庫藏等，然取僧祇薪草花果及竹木等，賣已自活或與餘人，是名第二大賊住在世間。
translation: Suppose a great thief has no hundreds, no thousands, and no hundreds of thousands of people, doesn't go to towns or villages, penetrates walls, unlocks keys, steals other things, doesn't stop traveling, burns villages, breaks up the king's treasury, and so forth, but takes incense, grass, flowers, fruit, bamboo, wood,

source_sentence: 又諸苾芻！
translation: Again, monks!

source_sentence: 有其大賊無百眾無千眾無百千眾，不往城邑聚落穿牆解鑰偷盜他物，乃至不取僧祇草等活命與人，然於自身實未證得上人之法，妄說已有，是名第三大賊住在世間。
translation: If there's a great thief who doesn't go to cities, towns, villages, penetrate walls, unlock keys, steal other things, or even steal in order to live and give them to people without grasping the saṃghâvaśeṣa and so forth, but he really hasn't realized the teaching of superior personhood on his own and falsely says it already exists, this

source_sentence: 汝諸苾芻！
translation: You monks!

source_sentence: 第一大賊、第二大賊，不名大賊，是名小賊。
translation: The first great thief and second great thief aren't called great thieves, which are called lesser thieves.

source_sentence: 汝諸苾芻！
translation: You monks!

source_sentence: 若實無上人之法自稱得者，於人、天魔、梵、沙門、婆羅門中，是極大賊。」
translation: If someone really claims to have attained the teaching of the unsurpassed person, they're a great thief among humans, gods, Māra, Brahmā, ascetics, and priests.

source_sentence: 「實非阿羅漢，　　說言我身是；
translation: You really aren’t an arhat, saying ‘I am a self.’

source_sentence: 於諸人天中，　　是名為大賊。」
translation: Among humans and gods, this is called a great thief.

source_sentence: 說伽他曰：爾時世尊種種呵責彼苾芻已，告諸苾芻曰：「我觀十利為諸弟子，於毘奈耶制其學處，應如是說：「若復苾芻實無知無遍知，自知不得上人法、寂靜聖者、殊勝證悟、智見安樂住，而言：『我知我見。』
translation: After the Bhagavān had variously rebuked that monk, he told the monks, I observed the ten benefits for my disciples and regulated their training place in Vinaya, saying, Again, if a monk really has no knowledge and no pervasive knowing and doesn't know for himself that he can't attain the superior person's Dharma, quiescence, tranquility, nobleness, superior realiza

source_sentence: 彼於異時若問、若不問，欲自清淨故作如是說：『諸具壽！
translation: At another time, if they ask or don't ask questions, they want to be self-clean and therefore say, 'Gushou!

source_sentence: 我實不知不見，言知言見。』
translation: I really don't know and don't see, and I say I know and say I see.'

source_sentence: 虛誑妄語，得波羅市迦，不應共住。」
translation: If you speak falsely and falsely, you'll get a pārājika, so you shouldn't live together.

source_sentence: 爾時世尊為諸苾芻制學處已，時有眾多苾芻在阿蘭若住，受麁臥具勤策相應，得少自相寂止方便，世間作意折伏煩惱，欲染瞋恚不復現行。
translation: After the Bhagavān had prescribed the training place for the monks, many monks then stayed in Araṇya, received coarse bedding and diligently applied themselves to it, attained a method of calming their own quiescence with little effort, subdued afflictions with worldly contemplation, and no longer practiced defilement by desire and anger.

source_sentence: 時彼即便更相告言：「具壽！
translation: They then even told each other, Kauṣṭhila!

source_sentence: 汝今知不？
translation: Do you now know it?

source_sentence: 阿蘭若中所應得者，我今已得。
translation: Whatever should be attained in a forest, I've attained it now.

source_sentence: 我生已盡、梵行已立，所作已辦、不受後有。
translation: My birth has ended, my religious practice has been established, what I should do has been done, and I won't be subject to later existences.

source_sentence: 我今可捨蘭若處住聚落中。」
translation: Now, I can abandon the place of Rāja and live in a village.

source_sentence: 便捨靜林就村而住。
translation: He then left the quiet forest and went to live in the village.

source_sentence: 時彼數數見諸女人，又見淨人及諸求寂共為雜住，煩惱還起、欲染瞋恚還復現行。
translation: They then repeatedly saw women, and they saw pure people and those seeking quiescence together as mixed living beings, where afflictions would arise again and again, and the stain of desire and anger would reappear in their present form.

source_sentence: 時彼諸人各作是念：「世尊為諸弟子於毘奈耶制其學處：若復苾芻實無知無遍知，自知不得上人法、寂靜聖者、殊勝證悟、智見安樂住，而言：『我知我見。』
translation: Those people then each thought, Bhagavān, for the sake of the disciples, regulate their training place in Vaiśālī: If a monk really has no knowledge and no pervasive knowing and doesn't know for himself that he can't attain the peaceful abiding of superior personhood, quiescence, nobleness, superior realization, and insight, he says, 'I know and see.'

source_sentence: 彼於異時若問、若不問，欲自清淨故作是說：『諸具壽！
translation: At another time, if they ask or don't ask questions, they want to be pure for themselves and say this, 'Gushou!

source_sentence: 我實不知不見，言知言見。』
translation: I really don't know and don't see, and I say I know and say I see.'

source_sentence: 虛誑妄語者，得波羅市迦，不應共住。」
translation: Those who speak falsely and falsely will attain pārājika, which shouldn't be shared with them.

source_sentence: 時諸苾芻即相告曰：「我等住阿蘭若，受麁臥具勤策相應，得少自相寂止方便折伏煩惱，便棄靜林來至聚落，既觀諸境煩惱現行，如前廣說，豈非我等犯他勝耶？
translation: The monks then told each other, We're staying in a forest, and we're engaged in the arousal of coarse bedding that's accompanied by diligence, attaining a little self-confused quiescence to skillfully subdue the afflictions, so we abandon the quiet forest and come to the village. Since we're observing the afflictions in their present form

source_sentence: 我等共詣具壽阿難陀所，以事陳告，如彼所說我當奉行。」
translation: Together, we went to Kauṣṭhila Ānanda and told him this, As he said, I will follow it.

source_sentence: 即便到彼問具壽阿難陀曰：「具壽！
translation: He went there and asked Kauṣṭhila Ānanda, Kauṣṭhila!

source_sentence: 知不？
translation: Do you know?

source_sentence: 如佛世尊為諸弟子制其學處：若復苾芻乃至波羅市迦不應共住。
translation: Suppose the Bhagavān sets up a place of training for his disciples: If they are again monks or even pārājikas, they shouldn't live together.

source_sentence: 我等在阿蘭若煩惱不起，今來聚落煩惱還生，廣說如前。
translation: We are in a forest where the afflictions don't arise, and now the afflictions return to life in a village, as explained above.

source_sentence: 我皆有疑，豈非我等犯波羅市迦耶？
translation: We all have doubts, aren't we the ones who violated the pārājika?

source_sentence: 當問具壽阿難陀，如彼所說我當奉行。
translation: You should ask Kauṣṭhila Ānanda, and as he explains it, I will follow it.

source_sentence: 由是事故我等今來，至具壽所詳欲諮決，豈非我等犯波羅市迦耶？」
translation: Because of this, we've come here now to the place where Kauśinagara wants to consult and decide, so isn't it true that we're violating the pārājika?

source_sentence: 爾時具壽阿難陀，聞諸苾芻說是事已，遂將諸人往世尊所，頂禮佛足在一面坐。
translation: When Kauśinagara Ānanda heard the monks explain these things, he led them to the Bhagavān, bowed his head at his feet, and sat to one side.

source_sentence: 時具壽阿難陀白佛言：「世尊大德！
translation: Kauṣṭhila Ānanda then said to the Buddha, Bhagavān!

source_sentence: 如是為諸苾芻，於毘奈耶制其學處：若復苾芻廣說乃至得波羅市迦不應共住。

translation: The king of Magadha who hadn't yet arisen an enemy has come to destroy our country, but now he's leaving to defend himself, and who will be victorious when the two armies are engaged?

translation: Maudgalyāyana gave us a prediction that the battle would be victorious.

translation: When the people heard this, they rejoiced and jumped with joy. They deceived the enemy to hide their failures and fought each other in battle. source_sentence: 時未生怨王便生是念：「此城中人心懷兇猛，今若渡河彼來取我，如網取魚盡當殺害。」
translation: The king of the enemy who hadn't yet arisen thought, This city has a fierce mind in its heart, and now if he crosses a river and comes to take me, he'll kill me like a fish caught in a net.

source_sentence: 作是念已遍告軍眾：「咸可併心迴兵共戰。」
translation: After he had this thought, he told the whole army, They can all combine their minds and return to fight together.

source_sentence: 眾聞王教各作是念：「我等辭國來罰廣嚴，今者不應被破而活。」
translation: Each of the people who heard the king's teaching had this thought, We left our countries and came to punish him with extensive punishment, but now we won't be able to break through and live.

source_sentence: 咸即同心迴兵共戰，時此城人遂便退敗，走入城中閉門自固。
translation: They all returned with one mind and joined in battle. The citizens of the city then withdrew and defeated each other, ran into the city wall, closed the gates, and resisted on their own.

source_sentence: 其摩揭陀王既得勝已，收軍率旅還王舍城。
translation: After the king of Magadha had won victory, he gathered his troops and returned to Rājagṛha.

source_sentence: 於後城中諸栗姑毘，於街衢巷陌共起譏嫌：「彼大目連記我戰勝，今我此城總被敗喪，何戰勝耶？」
translation: In the latter city, the Liputriyas in the streets and lanes criticized each other, saying, That great Maudgalyāyana remembered that I won the battle, but now that this city of mine has been completely defeated, how could I have won it?

source_sentence: 是時六眾苾芻入城乞食，聞彼譏嫌而問之曰：「汝等今者譏嫌何人？」
translation: The six monks then entered the city to solicit alms, heard their criticism, and asked them, Who are you criticizing him now?

translation: The six members of the congregation replied, What sins did we commit that caused you to criticize us?

source_sentence: 諸人報曰：「聖者！

source_sentence: 大目連記我戰勝，今我此城總被他破，豈戰勝耶？」
translation: Mahāmaudgalyāyana remembers that I won the battle, but now that this city of mine has been completely destroyed by others, isn't it a victory in battle?

source_sentence: 六眾答曰：「汝初鬪戰何國得勝？」
translation: The sixfold assembly answered, What country did you first fight and win?

source_sentence: 諸人報曰：「我等鬪戰初時得勝。」
translation: The people replied, At the beginning of the fight, we won.

source_sentence: 六眾答曰：「汝戰得勝即合却迴，誰更遣汝逐他軍眾。
translation: The sixfold assembly answered, When you've won the battle, you'll be united and withdrawn, so who else will send you to chase after other armies?

translation: Haven't you heard that the wilderness is forced to have the strength of a fierce tiger?

source_sentence: 彼諸人眾聞此語已，自知無理默然不答。
translation: After hearing these words, the people in the assembly knew it was unreasonable and remained silent, not answering.

source_sentence: 于時六眾苾芻共相謂曰：「我等且應時機答戰勝事，令彼人眾不作大嫌。
translation: The six monks and nuns then said to each other, Let's answer the victorious battle at the right time so that those people won't become greatly disgusted.

source_sentence: 然大目連有所犯罪，我今應詰令其說悔。」
translation: Still, there's a crime committed by Mahāmaudgalyāyana, so now I should interrogate him and make him repent.

source_sentence: 是時六眾苾芻既還住處，食已詣大目連所，合掌恭敬禮足白言：「我等今者諮詰少事，唯願慈悲賜垂聽許。」
translation: When the six monks returned to their dwelling place, they went to Mahāmaudgalyāyana after they had eaten, joined their palms and bowed respectfully at his feet, and said, Now, we're here to ask questions about a few things, but we entreat you to grant us permission with kindness and compassion.

source_sentence: 目連報曰：「五部之罪任意舉之。」
translation: Maudgalyāyana replied, The five kinds of crimes are freely cited.

source_sentence: 六眾白言：「尊者與栗姑毘記戰得勝，而廣嚴城被他所破，豈是勝耶？
translation: The sixfold assembly said, Isn't that superior when the Venerable is victorious in battle with Rṛgbodhi and his extensively adorned city is destroyed by others?

source_sentence: 持鉢乞食可不自供，而更妄語虛記他事，不見實狀令眾譏嫌，遂令我等所行之處，謗議盈途乞食不得。
translation: Don't make offerings to yourself with your bowl for alms, but instead lie and forget about other things; don't see their true form and cause others to criticize it, so we won't be allowed to beg for food on the way because of what we're doing.

translation: Since you've committed a crime, you should repent according to the rules.

translation: The director asked, What do you want to do?

translation: He answered, If someone doesn't see a violation of the lesser desire Maudgalyāyana, they should now be given the karma to abandon it.

translation: The donor then went with the six groups of people to the superior seat, and Kauṣṭhila Śāriputra was the superior seat for them.

translation: The donor then addressed the superior monk, You must ring a strong hammer.

translation: Don't allow the right teaching to cause harm, and who will do the pervasively abiding teaching for someone up to the point of expulsion?

translation: They replied, There's no such thing; it's just that Venerable Mahāmaudgalyāyana falsely remembers other things and explains them in detail as above, not wanting to see the offense.

translation: We follow the Dharma and perform the karman of not seeing sins.

translation: Don't do anything unlawful that disturbs the virtuous monks of Jīvaka.

translation: The great teacher, the Bhagavān, possesses omniscience and attains great mastery over all things.

translation: Now, you should go there and ask the Buddha to resolve your doubts, and follow what he teaches you accordingly.

source_sentence: 時諸苾芻以此因緣往白世尊，世尊告曰：「凡戰鬪時非人先戰後次於人，若非人戰勝人亦得勝。
translation: The monks then went to the Bhagavān for this reason, and the Bhagavān told them, Whenever there's a battle, non-people first fight and then people, and if someone who isn't fighting is victorious, they'll also win.

translation: At the time, Maudgalyāyana remembered that Rāmaputra was victorious, and then the vastly adorned city of not-people won in battle and the king's city of not-people didn't.

translation: When they arrived at the river bank, the king's city was not a place where people would be victorious and the vastly adorned city wouldn't be.

translation: He simply remembers the first superiority and doesn't remember the latter.

translation: They'd rather believe that non-Buddhists who don't believe in the ascetic or the son of Śākyamuni always cover their bodies with a monk's robe, like the bark of a birch tree without really knowing it.

translation: The six monks then went into the almsbowl to solicit alms, and when they heard these unpleasant words, they asked, Who do you people dislike?

translation: He replied, I dislike you!

translation: He told them, What's wrong with us that you criticize it?

translation: The people replied, “Maudgalyāyana will surely send down rain after seven days have passed.

source_sentence: 我等聞已，於倉廩內所有穀麥咸種田中，而天不雨。」
translation: We've heard that all the grains and wheat in the storehouse are planted in the fields, but it doesn't rain in heaven.

source_sentence: 六眾報曰：「汝等常親外道，若見彼記雲興電擊纔少霑灑，即便唱令天時大雨。
translation: The six members of the assembly replied, You're always close to non-Buddhists, and if you see their predictions, clouds will rise up and lightning will strike them with little rain, and they'll even call it a great rain in the sky.

source_sentence: 目連所記天雨尚多地有流水，然彼聖者豈為汝等作如是記，所種苗稼悉皆成熟？」
translation: Maudgalyāyana's prediction is that there will still be plenty of rain in the sky, but wouldn't that noble man make such a prediction for you because the crops he planted will all ripen?

translation: He replied, That's not the case.

translation: The six members of the congregation replied, If that's the case, what's wrong with them?

source_sentence: 六眾苾芻共相謂曰：「難陀、鄔波難陀！

translation: I'll answer the people at any time, but Mahāmaudgalyāyana with few desires commits a crime himself, so we'll tell them to repent.

source_sentence: 還入寺中食訖收衣鉢已，便往詣彼大目連所白言：「畔睇上座！」
translation: After he returned to the monastery and finished eating, he gathered his robes and bowl and went to that great Maudgalyāyana's place and said, Upagupta, sir!

translation: Maudgalyāyana replied, There's no illness.

translation: Again, he repeatedly said, The superior monk asks permission to allow me to do so, and I want to punish him.

translation: It's explained in detail up to Śāriputra as the superior monk, causing him to go to tell the Buddha.

source_sentence: 佛告諸苾芻：「有五因緣天不降雨，而星曆人不善了知記言天雨。
translation: The Buddha told the monks, There are five reasons why the gods don't send rain, and starry people who don't well know and remember it say heavenly rain.

translation: What are the five?

source_sentence: 苾芻當知！

translation: When clouds arise, lightning strikes the earth and thunder shakes the wind. At that time the stars and astronomers predict heavenly rain but this earth has its element of fire; rising up into space it causes rain to dry up. This is the first reason no rain occurs.

translation: If he sees clouds that give rise to wind and is frightened, then the stars and celestial recluses record heavenly rain; but when a great wind arises in the sky, it blows this rain inside the cane forest or among the karṇḍaāla trees or among the forests, causing rain to fall partially. source_sentence: 復次苾芻！

translation: If he sees clouds that give rise to wind and is frightened, then the stars and astronomers predict heavenly rain; but when it rains, the gods and goddesses are unruly and don't shower sweet rain at the right time. This is the third reason it doesn't rain.

source_sentence: 復次苾芻！

source_sentence: 乃至星曆人記言天雨，由諸有情愛樂惡法，非分起貪住於邪見，緣此事故於時時中天不降雨，此是第四不雨因緣。
translation: This is the fourth reason it doesn't rain because sentient beings delight in bad qualities and don't partly become greedy and stay in wrong views.

source_sentence: 復次苾芻！

translation: This is the fifth reason it doesn't rain, but the stars and celestials don't know that it's raining.

source_sentence: 苾芻當知！

translation: At the time, there were robeless non-Buddhist disciples living in this city, whose wife was pregnant.

translation: At that time, Gosshou Mahāmaudgalyāyana entered the city to solicit alms and went next to a house belonging to the heretical disciples. Seeing the venerable monk, the householders there thought:

translation: When everyone in the world heard that he was rich and prosperous, they all rejoiced and jumped for joy. They filled their bowls with delicious food and gave it to the venerable one, and then invited him again, saying, Come back tomorrow.
